fields.description:
Nature priest. Speaks to spirits and
beasts. Works subtle magics via sacred
markings and materials.
Quick, and skillful. Not above bending the rules or fighting dirty. Can be quite the charmer, too.
Not just a violent individualΓÇöour violent individual. A champion, yes, but a bit of a liability, too.
Settler of disputes, chronicler, and divine bulwark against chaos. Insightful, tough, not necessarily persuasive.

Invokes divine power via flame and
candle. Beacon of hope, charity, and
mercy. Fiery foe of the dark.
Leads the town's milita, plus a crew of followers. Makes choices about who lives and who dies.
Home in the wild, the one you want with you when you travel. A resourceful guide and deadly hunter.
Collector of lost lore and power, with potent artifacts that might well lead to their ruin.
They're in over their head and full of fear and anger, but they just might outshine us all.

Stonetop has long been home to a sacred order, keepers of the old ways and speakers for Danu. You are one such initiate, the most gifted in generations. You gain the Rites of the Land move. There are other initiates in Stonetop, serving the goddess and the village. They aid you as followers— you will be able to add 2-3 of the following initiates on the Initiates of Danu page.
fields.description2:
• Enfys, your acolyte, beloved by birds
  • Afon, strange and fae-touched
  • Gwendyl, your mentor, a talented healer
  • Olwin, your anointed lover, seer of fates
  • Seren the Eldest, wise and hard as winter

fields.description: Maybe not by wolves, but you grew up in the wild. Beasts of land and air were your siblings. The sighing wind taught you language. The trees and rocks were your home. Were you one of the Forest Folk? Abandoned or orphaned? Lured into the Wood? Regardless, you get the Trackless Step move (go mark it now). Also, when you Forage, you have advantage. For some reason, you’ve made yourself known to Stonetop and perhaps you even call it home. But the ways of humans are still strange to you. Once per session, when your wild ways off end or alienate you from someone, mark XP.

A seed of Danu’s power has taken root in your soul. Perhaps it has always been there and only recently sprouted. Or maybe it was planted in you during some portentous event. Regardless, your dreams have been haunted by strange markings and symbols. You feel the mystic power in plants, stones, and soil. And you’ve felt the growing wrath of the Earth Mother as foul things begin to move about. Take the Danu’s Grasp move (go mark it now). Danu’s power flows through you, but at great cost. When you would spend 1 Stock from your sacred pouch, you may choose to lose 2d4 HP instead.

You grew up around here, and always picked things up quickly. Reading and numbers, sure, but more. Hide and seek. Th rowing stones. Climbing. Fighting. Whatever you tried, you were good at it. As good as anyone else, if not better. Sure, you’ve got a reputation for bending the rules. Playing dirty. But why play if you don’t play to win, right? And who do they come to when there’s a problem needs solving? You, that’s who. When you Seek Insight, you may roll +INT instead of +WIS and add “What opportunity does no one else see?” to the list of possible questions.

You’re new to Stonetop, having left behind a... colorful past. How did you get into that life? Why and how did you get out? Who and what did you leave behind? Regardless, these people have taken you in. Time to lead an honest life, right? You start with either Burgle or Light Fingers (your choice) as an extra move, and either burglar tools or a hidden stash (your choice) as an additional special possession. Go mark them now.

You left long ago, travelling far and living by your wits. Why did you leave? What deeds do you boast of, and which do you regret? You always longed to return to Stonetop, and return you have. You're a bit of a celebrity now, and you've got friends (or close enough) strewn about the known world. When you declare that you know someone outside of Stonetop, someone who can help, name them and roll +CHA: on a 10+, yeah, they can help (tell us why they're willing); on a 7-9, they can help but pick 1 from the list below; on a 6-, the GM chooses 1 and then some.

  • They still hold a grudge
  • They're going to need something from you first
  • They swore off this sort of thing long ago
  • You can't exactly y'know trust them

You keep order in Stonetop and protect it from outside threats. It might not be anything offi cial, but everyone knows you've got a cool head and the weight to back up your words.

When you bark an order or warning, roll +CHA: on a 7+, they must choose 1:

  • Do what you say
  • Dig in/take cover/flee
  • Attack you

On a 10+, you can tell which one they're going to do and do something fi rst; gain advantage if you do.

You left behind a life of violence and a name mothers used to scare their children. For whatever reason, the people of Stonetop took you (back?) in and treat you like one of their own.

When you Persuade using violence or threats against someone who knows your black reputation, you can roll +STR instead of +CHA. Also, if you take the Formidable move, you can choose to roll +CON instead of +CHA.

When you fight to kill without mercy or hesitation, you deal +1d4 damage.

You’ve been touched by Tor (Rainmaker, Th underhead, Slayer-of-Beasts!) and bear runic markings similar to those etched into the Stone. When did the marks manifest? Are they a symbol of your strength, speed, and courage? Or their source?

You start with the Storm Markings major arcanum. Mark one of the boxes on the front of the Storm Markings sheet, and describe here the time you were struck by lightning and walked away unharmed:

You are the latest in a long line of Judges—born here, apprenticed to the prior Judge, and charged with the passing of the mantle. Th e Chronicle is a rich repository of lore, but there’s no index, so good luck fi nding anything. When you Know Things about the people or history of Stonetop, you have advantage. When you spend days, weeks, or months poring over the Chronicle, ask the GM a question, and the GM will tell you what you learn in that time.

You are part of a larger order of Aratis, sent to Stonetop to spread the faith and protect the fl ickering fl ame of civilization. Th e Chronicle is new and a work in progress; your position in town is far from certain. Add the following Judges to the Neighbors section of the Stonetop playbook:

  • Devin (from Marshedge)
  • Haeris (from Gordin's Delve)
  • Rahat (from Lygos)

When you call upon the Judge of another steading for aid or information, they are oath-bound to give it. You are likewise oathbound to support them.

You have a aviary in addition to your usual choice of special possessions. When you send a message via trained bird, as is the way of the Judges of your order, the GM will tell you if and when you receive a response, and what it says.

The line of Judges was broken long ago, the Chronicle lost or fallen into ruin. Aratis has called you personally to her service though dreams, omens, and visions. Some in town resent the authority you’ve assumed.

When you spend a few days communing with Aratis about a threat facing Stonetop or civilization as a whole, roll +WIS: on a 7+, Aratis reveals the course of action she would have you take; on a 10+, you also hold 2 Sanction. While acting on her orders, spend 1 Sanction to add +1 to a roll you just made.

You were born in Stonetop, and that birth was marked by the God of Light. You bear a sunshaped birthmark, perhaps, or maybe you were born during an eclipse?

Whatever the sign, your connection to Helior was clear early on. You’ve a place of honor in Stonetop, though it’d be a lie to say you don’t make some uneasy.

When one of your moves would cause you to mark a debility, you may mark this move instead, to no ill effect. When you Make Camp, clear the circle.

They think of you as a self-satisfied kook who comes through now and again, speaking in riddles and playing tricks with the light. Sure, they know thereΓÇÖs something holy about you, but itΓÇÖs not like youΓÇÖre a priest or anything. Priests talk sense.

When you go off a-wandering, hold 1 Enigma if youΓÇÖre gone for days, 2 if youΓÇÖre gone for weeks, or 3 if youΓÇÖre gone for months. At the very start of play, hold 3 Enigma. Spend Enigma 1-for-1 to:

  • Return from your wandering exactly when and where you are needed, fully Outfitted
  • Know Things as if you rolled a 10+, drawing on what you learned while away
  • Have What You Need to produce an oddly specific yet mundane item of Value 1 or less

You led a worldly life. A life of fear and doubt, base pleasures and petty grudges. A life like so many others. But something happened—injury, illness, a brush with Death; perhaps a moment of such profound misery and self-loathing that you thought you could fall no further.

There, in the dark, Helior’s light shined upon you, igniting in your soul, lifting you and fi lling you with a profound sense of purpose.

When you Persuade a group by preaching charity, mercy, and hope and roll a 7+, aside from the usual effect, choose 1:

  • Your name and your message spread
  • Someone approaches you, now or later, eager to know more

You grew up here, descended from a long line. Some of the biggest names in Stonetop’s past are perched in your family tree. Everyone in the village takes your authority as a given, and your crew is a well-established institution in town.

You start with the Veteran Crew move, in addition to your usual moves. Go mark it now.

When you create your Crew, they automatically have the respected tag (in addition to your usual picks, and any you get from Veteran Crew).

Before you came here, you led a band of ne’er-dowells: bandits, raiders, or bloody-handed mercenaries. But something changed. A moment of truth led you and your followers—some of them at least—to leave that life behind. And for whatever reason, the people of Stonetop took you in.

When you draw on your bloody past to Know Things, you may roll +STR instead of +INT. If you do, the GM will ask you who you wronged back then or who might still hold a grudge. Answer them now.

When you create your Crew, they automatically have the warriors tag (in addition to your usual picks).

You’re a natural leader—your words inspire, your plans win the day, your deeds are recounted far and wide. Are you touched by the gods? Does ancient blood flow in your veins? Or are you simply the champion that Stonetop needs in these trying times?

You start with the We Happy Few move, in addition to your usual moves. Go mark it now.

When you create your Crew, they automatically have the devoted tag (in addition to your usual picks).

You are a hunter of the Great Wood, the best the town has seen in generations. You know every part of the Wood within a two-day march.

You start with both the Expert Tracker move and the Stalker move. Go mark them now.

You have travelled much of the known world and perhaps parts beyond. Add each of the following to the Neighbors list in the Stonetop playbook, choosing 1 trait for each:

  • Ennis (from Marshedge)
  • Shahar (from Gordin's Delve)
  • Yannic (from the Hillfolk)
  • Tovia (from Lygos)
  • Sasca (from northern Manmarch)

You start with the Mental Map move. Mark it now.

When you Know Things about the wider world, you can roll +WIS instead of +INT.

When you arrive somewhere you’ve visited before (your call), tell the GM when you were last here, and the GM will tell you how it’s changed.

You grew up civilized, but your soul is bound to a beast of the wild. You’re closer to it than to any man or woman. How did this bond come about? How long ago? Regardless, you start with the Animal Companion move. Go mark it now.

When you focus on your animal companion for a few moments, you can use any of the actions below, no matter the distance between you. Mark 1 action at 1st level, then another at 3rd, 5th, 7th, and 9th
fields.description2:
• Call it back to your side
  • Sense its emotional state
  • Get a brief impression of what it senses
  • Lend it your strength--lose 1d6 HP, and it regains an equal amount

fields.description:
These people are family. Chaos grows all around, but youΓÇÖll be damned if youΓÇÖll let your family come to harm. Damned indeed.

You have sought out and embraced dark power to protect that which you hold dear. Or perhaps that power fell upon you, and you took it up for the greater good. Either way, you seek more.

You start with the LetΓÇÖs Make a Deal move (mark it now) and are Well Versed in the Things Below. YouΓÇÖve also acquired 1 major arcanum (you will be able to choose after you create your character):
fields.description2:
• The Hec'tumel Codex
  • The Red Scepter
  • The Staff of the Lidless Orb

fields.description:
The past has buried many secrets, and you are determined to dig them up. Years of study across the land have led you here, and you are convinced that this town holds the key to your greatest discoveries. What is it you hope to find? What is it that keeps you here?

In any case, your travels and studies mean that you start with the Polyglot move (mark it now) and that you are Well Versed in the Makers and their arts. YouΓÇÖve also acquired 1 major arcanum (you will be able to choose the arcana after you create your character):
fields.description2:
• Noruba's Ice Sphere
  • The Azure Hand
  • The Mindgem

fields.description:
YouΓÇÖve dedicated your life to rooting out and destroying horrors and their servants. What set you down this path? What did you sacrifi ce to walk it? What led you to call Stonetop home?

Regardless, you start with the Everything Bleeds move (mark it now) and are Well Versed in (pick 1):

  • The fae
  • The Things Below
  • The Last Door and what lies beyond

YouΓÇÖve also acquired 1 major arcanum
fields.description2:
• The Demonhide Cloak
  • The Redwood Effigy
  • The Twisted Spear

fields.description:
Stonetop has always been home, but you chafe at the demands of mundane life and have always longed for more. Excitement! Danger! When you make a move and come up short, you can give it your all and turn a 6- into a 7-9, a 7-9 into a 10+, and (if it matters), a 10-11 into a 12+. But if you do, pick 1 (the GM will fill in the details):

  • You get hurt (2d4 damage and an actual injury)
  • You cause collateral damage, endanger others, or otherwise escalate the situation
  • Something on your person is lost or breaks
You once led a simple life, but something happened. Something changed you, burdened you with terrible purpose. What was it?
fields.description2:
• A loved one was killed or abducted
  • Someone gave their life to save you
  • Your idol sacrificed themselves to save many
  • You stumbled upon a dark mystery
  • You must make amends for a terrible mistake
fields.description3: You always have the option of Burning Bright; you can spend 2 XP after you roll to add +1, even if you don’t have enough XP to level.

fields.description3: When you start a session, roll +Omens: on a 7+, lose all Omens and the GM will describe a dream, vision, or portent that points toward your fate; also, on a 10+, ask the GM a follow-up question and get a clear, helpful answer; on a 6-, donΓÇÖt mark XP, hold +1 Omen, and tell us of the nightmares youΓÇÖve been having and how your fears play into them. When you are at DeathΓÇÖs Door, ask yourself, ΓÇ£Is my destiny fulfilled?ΓÇ¥ If it is not, treat a miss as a 7-9 and a 7-9 as a 10+.

fields.name: PACIFIST
fields.description: To prevent suffering in the world.

fields.name: NURTURE
fields.description: To help others grow, learn, or improve.

fields.name: FREEDOM
fields.description: To chafe against rules, expectations, and obligations.

fields.name: COMFORT
fields.description: To enjoy yourself and avoid hardship.

fields.name: DELIGHT
fields.description: to find beauty

fields.name: DETATCHMENT
fields.description: To remain unmoved

fields.name: PRESERVATION
fields.description: To protect the natural world.

fields.name: REVERENCE
fields.description: To demand sacrifice.

fields.name: CONSCIENCE
fields.description: To feel guilty, to try to do right.

fields.name: PRESTIGE
fields.description: To impress others, to build a name for yourself.

fields.name: TRICKERY
fields.description: To deceive, misdirect, outthink

fields.name: PEACE
fields.description: To avoid (further) bloodshed or violence.

fields.name: PRIDE
fields.description: To maintain your dignity, to demand respect.

fields.name: RECKLESSNESS
fields.description: To act without thought to the consequences.

fields.name: TROUBLE
fields.description: To stick your nose in where it's unwelcome.

fields.name: VIOLENCE
fields.description: To solve problems by force.

fields.name: AMBITION
fields.description: To increase your status or influence.

fields.name: DISPASSION
fields.description: To disregard emotion or sentiment.

fields.name: HARMONY
fields.description: To seek a path that makes everyone happy.

fields.name: ORTHODOXY
fields.description: To strictly adhere to rules and traditions.

fields.name: ZEAL
fields.description: To judge quickly and without doubt.

fields.name: CHARITY
fields.description: To go without so that others are better off.

fields.name: HOPE
fields.description: To inspire others in the face of adversity.

fields.name: MERCY
fields.description: To bring relief or comfort, to give second chances.

fields.name: PRAISE
fields.description: To spread the glory and worship of Helior.

fields.name: RIGHTEOUSNESS
fields.description: To refuse to suffer an injustice or a lesser evil.

fields.name: AUTHORITY
fields.description: To take charge and throw your weight around.

fields.name: CAUTION
fields.description: To keep everyone safe, to agonize over decisions.

fields.name: DRIVE
fields.description: To take on ever more responsibility.

fields.name: HONOR
fields.description: To keep your word, to follow a moral code.

fields.name: RUTHLESSNESS
fields.description: To do whatever it takes to win or survive.

fields.name: ADVENTURE
fields.description: To test yourself, to experience new things.

fields.name: INDEPENDENCE
fields.description: To refuse help and push others away.

fields.name: STEWARDSHIP
fields.description: To value beasts and natural places over people.

fields.name: Tenacity
fields.description: To be stubborn, to persist.

fields.name: WONDER
fields.description: To marvel at beauty, magnificence, splendor.

fields.name: CUNNING
fields.description: To scheme, manipulate, and plot.

fields.name: CURIOSITY
fields.description: To seek answers that maybe you oughtn't.

fields.name: HUBRIS
fields.description: To assume you know best, that you can't fail.

fields.name: MYSTERY
fields.description: To avoid straight answers; to keep secrets.

fields.name: VISION
fields.description: To think big and pursue grandiose goals.

fields.name: DEFIANCE
fields.description: To refuse to back down, give up, give in.

fields.name: DOUBT
fields.description: To question yourself, your actions, your worth.

fields.name: EARNESTNESS
fields.description: To prove yourself, to yourself and others.

fields.name: OPTIMISM
fields.description: To assume the best, and that things are simple.

fields.name: SACRIFICE
fields.description: To put the needs/wants of others above your own.

the wild. Restore 1 use each season.

shears, mortars & pestles, herbs,

 Each spring, d4 uses of bendis root (reach, area,
 burns ~1 hr, fumes repel perversions of nature).

fields.description2:

  • ΓùçΓùçLong spear, fine steel (reach, 2 piercing)
  • Γùç Battleaxe, iron (close, messy)
  • Γùç Compound box (far, +1 damage, x piercing;  Γ¡ÿ low ammo, Γ¡ÿ all out)

fields.description: (far, +1 damage, x piercing; Γ¡ÿ low ammo,Γ¡ÿ all out)

fields.description2:
• ΓùçΓùç A shield, bearing ___ΓÇÖs crest
  • Γùç A wool cloak, woven just for you by ___
  • A letter, spattered with tears & blood
  • A flute, a gift from someone you loved
  • A fine locket, holding a strand of hair
  • A tinderbox, lovingly engraved

fields.name: Sword
fields.description: Γùç Sword, iron (close, +1 damage)

fields.name: Battleaxe
fields.description: Γùç Battleaxe, iron (close, messy)

fields.name: Warhammer
fields.description: Γùç Warhammer, iron (close, 2 piercing)

fields.name: Mace or flail
fields.description: Γùç Mace or flail, iron (close, forceful)

fields.name: Crossbow
fields.description: Γùç Crossbow (far, +1 damage, reload, x piercing)

fields.name: AMULETS & TALISMANS
fields.description: When you craft a protective charm for someone, spend 1 Stock and name a source of harm (fire, stabbing, etc.). When they would suffer such harm while bearing your charm, roll +INT: on a 10+, they ignore the harm entirely; on a 7-9, they suffer only half the damage or effect; on a 6-, they suffer the harm normally. One can benefit from only 1 charm at a time, and it loses its potency after 1 use.

fields.name: SPIRIT TONGUE
fields.description: You can speak with natural beasts and spirits of the wild. You can always ask the GM “what spirits are active here?” and get an honest answer.

fields.name: BORROW POWER
fields.description: When a spirit or beast loans you power, ask the GM for one of its tags or moves. Store it in your pouch in place of 1 Stock. When you use the borrowed tag or move, roll +WIS: on a 10+, you do it and can use the power again; on a 7-9, you do it, but lose the power.

fields.name: VOICE OF THE EARTH MOTHER
fields.description: When you speak on behalf of Danu, natural beasts and spirits of the wild respect your authority. All but the most headstrong will do as you command, even against their instincts.

fields.name: BARKSKIN
fields.description: When you are touching the ground, you have 2 armor. When you mark another with 1 Stock, they gain this benefit so long as the mark remains.

fields.name: BIG MAGIC
fields.description: Each time you take this move, choose an additional remarkable trait for your sacred pouch and increase your max Stock by 2.

fields.name: HEALERΓÇÖS ARTS
fields.description: When someone Recovers under your care, they recover (extra) HP equal to your WIS. If you also spend 1 Stock, they heal an extra 5 HP and their wounds/injuries are stabilized.

fields.name: CALL THE SPIRITS
fields.description: When you perform a short ritual and invoke the spirit(s) of a place or object, spend 1 Stock. The spirit(s) manifest before you and will hear what you have to say. What they do next is up to them.

fields.name: DANU'S GRASP
fields.description:
When you call on the world itself to bind a spirit or a perversion of nature, spend 1 Stock and roll +WIS: on a 10+, choose 2 from the list below; on a 7-9, choose 1.

  • You avoid or prevent their counterattack
  • Roots, vines, and earth restrain them
  • They take 2d4 damage (ignores armor)

If this brings them to 0 HP, they are pulled into the earth and bound in rune-etched stone.

fields.name: HEED MY WORDS
fields.description: When you Persuade by talking sense or warning against foolishness, you have advantage.

fields.name: IMPROVED STAT
fields.description: Each time you take this move, increase one of your stats by 1 (to a max of +2).

fields.name: INTO THE LION'S DEN
fields.description: When you approach a beast calmly and show no fear, it will not harm you—though it may well threaten you and test your nerve. When you lay your hand gently upon a beast, it will calm to your touch.

fields.name: LIGHTNING ROD
fields.description: When you Defend while touching the ground, you can spend 1 Readiness to intercept a nearby magical attack and redirect it harmlessly into the ground.

fields.name: RITES OF THE LAND
fields.description: When Seasons Change and you oversee the sacred rites, you can sacrifice 2 Surplus to increase the steading’s Fortunes by 1 (max +3). If you sacrifice something (or someone) much-loved and greatly valued, you can redo a roll from Seasons Change, with your choice of advantage or disadvantage.

fields.name: TRACKLESS STEP
fields.description: When you move through nature with care and patience, you make no sound, leave no trace and can ignore any hindering or treacherous terrain (briars, mire, scree, etc.). When you spend 1 Stock and mark others, they each gain this benefit so long as the mark remains. 1 Stock can mark a number of individuals up to your level +INT.

fields.name: VEIL
fields.description:
When you wrap yourself or another in a subtle veil, spend 1 Stock and choose 1:

  • A type of being you name (including “people”) will tend to ignore your presence
  • People will perceive you as someone else, though you must wear something of an individual’s in order to impersonate them

When your deception comes under scrutiny, roll +INT: on a 10+, the veil holds, and no one is the wiser; on a 7-9, the veil holds, but there is further scrutiny or a complication (GM’s choice).

fields.name: WARDS & BINDINGS
fields.description:
When you mark a boundary with sacred signs, spend 1 Stock and describe who or what they affect (using no more words than your level). Also, choose whether the affected beings are repelled or trapped by the signs.

When your wards or bindings are first tested, roll +INT: on 10+, they will hold as long as the signs remain unmarred (and the affected creature can do nothing to affect them directly); on a 7-9, they hold for now but may be overcome through might or will.

fields.name: WILD SOUL
fields.description: Each time you take this move, gain a Ranger move of your choice for which you qualify. You can’t pick Improved Stat or Superior Stat.

fields.name: NATURE'S WRATH
fields.description: Danu’s Grasp gains the area tag and can affect any creature. A mortal reduced to 0 HP is subdued or killed (your choice) rather than bound in stone.

fields.name: POTENT WORKINGS
fields.description:
When you craft a protective charm, you may spend 1 additional Stock to choose 1:

  • Name an additional type of harm
  • On a 10+, the charm retains its potency

fields.name: SUCK THE POISON OUT
fields.description:
When you draw a malady from a patient's body, mind, or soul, spend 1 Stock and roll +WIS: on a 10+, you remove the malady and can safely discard it or store it in your sacred pouch (taking the space of 1 Stock) to study or inflict on another; on a 7-9, you remove it, but choose 1:

  • Your patient suffers lingering harm or trauma
  • You suffer some of the malady's effects
  • It will be harmful and dangerous to discard

fields.name: SHARED SOULS
fields.description: When you mark a beast with 1 Stock, you can direct its actions and perceive through its senses no matter the distance between you. Treat it as a follower with 3 Loyalty; when you spend its last Loyalty, the effect ends.

fields.name: SUPERIOR STAT
fields.description: Increase one of your stats by +1 (to a max of +3).

fields.name: ALL IN THE WRIST
fields.description: Any knife or dagger gets the thrown tag in your hands. Also, you keep a number of iron throwing blades (near) on you; they don’t take up space in your inventory. Your ammo replenishes whenever you Outfit.

fields.name: AMBUSH
fields.description:
When you attack someone up close and they don't see it coming, deal your damage or roll +DEX: on a 10+, deal your damage and pick 2; on a 7-9, deal your damage and pick 1.

  • Deal +1d4 damage
  • Stop them from making noise/raising an alarm
  • Slip away before they can react
  • Create an opportunity; you or an ally gains advantage on the next move to act on it

fields.name: BURGLE
fields.description:
When you break into a place or thing, roll +INT: on a 10+, you're in, but pick 1; on a 7-9, you're in, but pick 2:

  • It took a fair but of time/effort
  • You made a lot of noise
  • You broke something on your way in
  • You had to use up 1d4 small items (say what)

fields.name: CATLIKE
fields.description: When you carry a light load and move with care, you make no noise. When you keep still in shadows or darkness, you remain unseen until you draw attention to yourself, move positions, or attack.

fields.name: DABBLER
fields.description: Each time you take this move, choose a move from the Heavy, Marshal, Ranger, or Seeker playbooks for which you otherwise qualify. (You can’t take Improved Stat or Superior Stat.)

fields.name: DANGER SENSE
fields.description:
You can always ask the GM, “Is there an ambush or trap here?” If they say “yes,” roll +INT: on a 10+, ask the GM both of the questions below; on a 7-9, ask 1; either way, gain advantage on your next roll to act on the answer(s).

  • What will trigger the ambush or trap?
  • What will happen once it's triggered?

On a 6-, don't mark XP; you know there's a trap or ambush, but nothing bad happens just yet.

fields.name: FREE RUNNING
fields.description: When you carry a light load and move with speed and grace, gain advantage on any move to surmount or bypass a physical obstacle.

fields.name: IRRESISTIBLE
fields.description: When you interact with someone, you can ask their player if they find you attractive and get an honest answer (usually “yes”). When you Persuade by using your considerable charms as leverage, you have advantage.

fields.name: ARMORED
fields.description:
When you carry a shield, mark only Γùç (instead of ΓùçΓùç), and ignore the cumbersome tag (you don’t suffer disadvantage for wearing it).

If you take this move at the start of play, add an Γùç iron hauberk,Γùç bronze cuirass, or Γùç scale coat to your inventory (all are 2 armor, warm, cumbersome).

fields.name: DANGEROUS
fields.description: When you deal your damage, you have advantage.

fields.name: HARD TO KILL
fields.description: When you are at Death's Door, you can roll +CON or +nothing (your choice). On a 7-9, you can mark a debility of your choice to regain 1 HP.

fields.name: UNCANNY REFLEXES
fields.description: When you are unarmored and carrying a normal or light load, you impose disadvantage on any damage you take that you could dodge or roll with.

fields.name: CONSECRATED FLAME
fields.description: When you whisper words of consecration to a flame, the flame casts a holy light. Holy light is uncomfortable for creatures of darkness to look upon, but does no true harm. The holy light lasts until the flame goes out or until you consecrate another flame, whichever comes first.

fields.name: INVOKE THE SUN GOD
fields.description:
When you imbue a holy light with Helior's power, choose an Invocation you know and roll +WIS: on a 10+, it works as described but you must choose 1 consequence from the list below; on a 7-9, it works as described, but you and the GM each choose 1.

  • The invocation has its reduced effect
  • The effort taxes you; mark a debility
  • The light is snuffed out when the Invocation is complete, its fuel consumed
  • You must bask in the sunlight for an hour or so before using that Invocation again

See the Invocation page for details.

fields.name: A CANDLE AGAINST THE DARK
fields.description: When you wield a holy light but go otherwise unarmed, you have 2 Armor.

fields.name: FIRE WITHIN
fields.description: When you are in darkness, you are able to see by the light of your inner fire. When you take damage from cold or fire, reduce that damage by 2

fields.name: GUIDING LIGHT
fields.description: When you lead one or more NPCs through danger, roll +CHA: on a 10+, you all make it through (Helior be praised); on a 7-9, the GM will tell you what’s required to get everyone through safely.

fields.name: CREW
fields.description: You’ve got a crew of stalwarts, six or so residents of Stonetop with some steel to them. See the Crew page for details

fields.name: LOGISTICS
fields.description: When you have a steading Muster or Pull Together, or when you Requisition, you have advantage.

fields.name: HOME ON THE RANGE
fields.description: When a journey requires you to Defy Danger or Struggle as One, treat a 6- as a 7-9.

fields.name: STALKER
fields.description: When you carry a normal or light load and move with care, you make no noise and leave no sign of your passing. When you hide yourself in a natural environment, you remain unseen until you draw attention to yourself, move positions, or attack

fields.name: EXPERT TRACKER
fields.description:
When you Seek Insight by searching for tracks or studying the signs left by passing creatures, you can ask “What happened here recently?” for free, even on a 6-.

When you follow a creature’s trail, roll +WIS: on a 7+ you follow the trail to a significant change in direction, terrain, or mode of transport; on a 10+, you can also ask the GM a reasonable question about your quarry and get an honest, useful answer.

fields.name: CENSURE
fields.description:
When you first denounce someone (or thing) as an agent of chaos or anathema to civilization, pick 1:

  • You/your allies deal +1 damage against them
  • They deal -1 damage
  • They recoil and might be momentarily stunned

The bonus/penalty ends if you use this move again.

fields.name: CHRONICLER OF STONETOP
fields.description:
When you write up detailed session notes and share them with the other players, hold +1 Diligence.

You can spend 1 Diligence at any time to add +1 to a roll that you or a fellow player just made

fields.name: WELL VERSED
fields.description: Mark 1 topic, in addition to the one noted in your Background. Each additional time you take this move, mark 2 more topics.
fields.description2:
• The Last Door, and the undead
  • The civilizations of humanity
  • The fae and their strange ways
  • The Makers and their arts
  • The primordial powers
  • The Things Below
  • The wild world and its spirits
fields.description3: When you Know Things about one of your topics, you can ask the GM a follow-up question of your choice (even on a 6-).

fields.name: WORK WITH WHAT YOU'VE GOT
fields.description:
When you wield your environment against your foe(s), choose 1 from the list below and roll +INT: on a 7+, it works! On a 10+, pick 1 more—you get that, too.

  • Impede or interrupt their actions
  • Create an advantage that grants you or an ally advantage on the next roll to exploit it
  • Deal damage appropriate to the source (d4 for bruises/scrapes, d6 for bloodshed, d8 if it'd break bones, d10 if it'd kill a common person)

fields.name: LET'S MAKE A DEAL
fields.description: When you Seek Insight, add “What do they really want or need?” to the list of questions. When you Persuade by offering them something that you know they want or need, treat a 7-9 as a 10+.

fields.name: POLYGLOT
fields.description:
When you first encounter a living language in play, describe your proficiency with it (if any) and how you came to acquire it.

When you Know Things about any script, text, runes or symbols that you encounter, you have advantage.

fields.name: EVERYTHING BLEEDS
fields.description: When you exploit an unnatural foe’s specific weakness or vulnerability, deal +1d6 damage.

fields.name: SILVER TONGUED
fields.description:
When you use words to avoid suspicion or trouble, roll +CHA: on a 10+, hold 3 Nerve; on a 7-9, hold 1 Nerve. You may spend Nerve, 1-for-1, to:

  • Move about or maneuver unchallenged
  • Withstand direct scrutiny or questioning
  • Direct suspicion or attention elsewhere

fields.name: ANIMAL COMPANION
fields.description: You are accompanied by a beast of uncommon loyalty and cleverness. See the Animal Companion page for details.

fields.name: ANGER IS A GIFT
fields.description:
When you burn with righteous anger (see Fear & Anger on back of playbook), hold 2 Resolve. You can spend your Resolve 1-for-1 to:

  • Set aside fear and doubt to do what must be done
  • Act suddenly, catching them off-guard
  • Inspire allies or bystanders to follow your lead
  • Strike hard (+1d4 damage, forceful)
  • Keep your footing, position, and/or your course despite what befalls you

fields.name: POTENTIAL FOR GREATNESS
fields.description: Once per level, when you roll a stat and get a 10+, mark one of the following (note the level during which you marked it). You don’t have to mark them in order.
fields.description2:
• Increase the stat you rolled by 1, to a max of +2
  • Increase the stat you rolled by 1, to a max of +2
  • Increase the stat you rolled by 1, to a max of +2
  • Increase the stat you rolled by 1, to a max of +2
  • Increase your max HP by 4
  • Increase your damage die to a d8

fields.name: LAUGH AT DANGER
fields.description: When you are about to roll +CON and you make a joke about the adversity you face, you can roll +CHA instead.

fields.name: LIGHT FINGERS
fields.description: When you perform sleight of hand on an unwary mark, you succeed and no one’s the wiser. If you’re being watched, roll +DEX: on a 10+, you succeed and no one’s the wiser; on a 7-9, you succeed OR no one’s the wiser (your choice).

fields.name: PERCEPTIVE
fields.description: When you Seek Insight, you may ask 1 additional question. Even on a 6-, you can ask 1 question (though you might not like how you learn the answer).

fields.name: RAPIER WIT
fields.description:
When you pierce an NPC’s pride with a well-placed quip, they must do 1 (their choice):

  • Attack, doing +1d4 damage if they hit but giving you advantage on your next roll against them
  • Stoop to your level and respond in kind
  • Spend a few moments fuming

fields.name: SKILL AT ARMS
fields.description: When you wield a spear, sword, or staff, it has the precise tag (you can Clash with DEX).

fields.name: PARRY & RIPOSTE
fields.description: When you Defend with a precise weapon, you can spend 1 Readiness to both halve an attack’s effects/damage and strike back at the attacker (deal your damage with disadvantage), instead of spending 1 Readiness for each.

fields.name: UNDER YOUR SKIN
fields.description:
When you engage an NPC in conversation, you can ask the GM 1 of these and get an honest answer:

  • What are they expecting me to do?
  • What, in general, are they trying to hide?
  • What do they want to happen?

fields.name: AEGIS OF FAITH
fields.description: When you bear a shield, it can turn away spells, magical effects, and insubstantial attacks as if they were physical blows.

fields.name: BEAR WITNESS
fields.description: When you speak the truth with conviction and candor, none can doubt you. They might deny what you say, but in their hearts they recognize the truth.

fields.name: BREAK BREAD
fields.description: When you share a proper meal with someone and each of you eats their fill, each of you recovers 1d8 (extra) hit points.

fields.name: BULWARK
fields.description: When you Defend, you can spend 1 Readiness to stand fast, holding your position despite what befalls you

fields.name: FOR THE GREATER GOOD
fields.description: When you Persuade someone to act in defense of their community or civilization at large, you have advantage.

fields.name: HOUND OF ARATIS
fields.description: When you Seek Insight, you can always ask “What here is tainted by chaos?” for free, even on a 6-.

fields.name: LIKE A DOG WITH A BONE
fields.description: When you attack something you know to be tainted by chaos, deal +1d6 damage.

fields.name: KNOWLEDGE IS POWER
fields.description: When you roll 10+ to Know Things, you or an ally gain advantage on the next roll to act on what you learn.

fields.name: MANY HANDS MAKE LIGHT WORK
fields.description: When you jump in to help another character who just rolled, tell us how and ask the GM what else is required or what the consequences will be. If you accept, increase your ally’s roll by +1.

fields.name: A BUNDLE OF STICKS UNBROKEN
fields.description: When you Struggle as One, you and one ally of your choice have advantage.

fields.name: THE HAMMER AND THE BOOK
fields.description:
When you strike a thing of supernatural chaos, roll +WIS: on a 10+, deal your damage and choose 1 from the list below; on a 7-9, deal damage and choose 1, but you also expose yourself to harm or unwanted attention.

  • Deal +1d6 damage
  • Ignore the thing’s armor or other defenses
  • Suppress one of its unnatural powers
  • Force it from its host

fields.name: TRUTH OR CONSEQUENCES
fields.description: When you look into someone’s eyes and gaze upon their soul, you can ask their player, “Are you lying or hiding something from me?” and get an honest answer. If the answer is “Yes,” you have advantage on your next roll against them. When you lie or otherwise deceive someone through words, you have disadvantage on your next roll against them.

fields.name: BINDING ARBITRATION
fields.description: When you bear witness to someone’s promise or oath, henceforth you may ask their player if they have kept their word. They must answer honestly. The character need not be present. If they have broken their word, you gain advantage on all rolls against them until they admit their wrong and suffer an appropriate consequence (your call).

fields.name: VISION UNCLOUDED
fields.description: When you Seek Insight, you can always ask “What here is hidden by illusion or magic?” for free, even on a 6-.

fields.name: WELL-READ
fields.description: When you name the source in which you read about the matter at hand, roll +WIS to Know Things instead of +INT.

fields.name: ARMISTICE
fields.description: When you approach an enemy to negotiate in good faith, they will at least hear you out. Even the most debased and savage foe will delay violence until you’ve had your say.

fields.name: CONDEMN
fields.description: When you Censure someone, they are marked with a mystical brand that cannot be removed or hidden until you dismiss it. Any intelligent creature who sees the mark recognizes the bearer as an agent of chaos and anathema to civilization.

fields.name: PROCLAMATION
fields.description: When you Censure, you may denounce a group or faction as long as you can clearly identify them. Apply the effects of Censure to every member of that group, regardless of distance.

fields.name: A MIGHTY RAMPART
fields.description:
When you hold Readiness (from Defend), you cannot be forced from your position. Also, you can spend 1 Readiness to completely ignore the effects/ damage of an attack that you suffer.

(Replaces BULWARK)

fields.name: MIRRORSHIELD
fields.description: When you Defend with a shield, you can spend 1 Readiness to intercept a magical force and redirect it to a different target (or none).

fields.name: THE TOWER ETERNAL
fields.description: When you Defy Danger against magic, treat a result of 6- as a 7-9.

fields.name: CASTIGATE
fields.description: When you Censure someone (or thing), pick 2 effects instead of 1.

fields.name: LUMINOUS SHIELD
fields.description:
When you brandish a holy light to turn aside an attack against body, mind, or soul, roll +CHA: on a 10+, pick 2; on a 7-9, pick 1.

  • The attack is deflected, doing no harm
  • The attacker, if in range of your light, is briefly blinded
  • Your holy light is not extinguished

fields.name: ALL IS ILUMINATED
fields.description:
When you look closely on another and see their soul laid bare, roll +WIS: on a 10+, ask their player 1 question from the list below, plus “And what would make them feel loved, beautiful, or worthy?”; on a 7-9, ask them 1 question from the list. In any case, they must answer truthfully.

  • Of what are they most ashamed?
  • What do they most desire or covet?
  • What hope have they abandoned?
  • Who or what is most precious to them?

fields.name: AND BEHOLD A PALE HORSE
fields.description: When you spend the night gazing into a flame, ask the GM to reveal an impending doom or grim portent that will come to pass unless you intervene, and how you might yet do so.

fields.name: HELIOR'S UNBLINKING EYE
fields.description:
When you stare into the sun long enough to lose your vision, name a person or place that you know and roll +WIS: on a 10+, you briefly glimpse your subject as if from a great height, and choose 2 from the list below; on a 7-9, you briefly glimpse your subject as if from a great height, and choose 1:

  • The glimpse lasts as long as you wish
  • Your point of view shifts to very close range
  • You recover your vision quickly

fields.name: KEEP THE HOME-FIRES BURNING
fields.description: When you build a camp fire and sprinkle it with ash from your own hearth, anyone who Makes Camp with you is free from nightmares or bad dreams and recovers (extra) HP equal to your CHA.

fields.name: LAMPLIGHTER
fields.description: When you whisper to a flammable object (torch, wick, kindling, etc.), it ignites in moments.

fields.name: PIETY
fields.description: When you spend at least an hour in proper worship to Helior, hold 1 Blessing. Other faithful PCs who partake in this worship also hold 1 Blessing. At any time, you can spend 1 Blessing to add +1 to a roll you just made in pursuit of a righteous cause.

fields.name: PURIFYING FLAMES
fields.description: When you wield a holy light against a creature of darkness, it counts as a weapon (d10 damage, ignores armor, range equal to your light source) and you can use WIS to Clash or Let Fly.

fields.name: RADIANT COUNTENANCE
fields.description: When you give someone your fond attention, you can then Persuade them with advantage. If they are a follower, you can instead choose to Strengthen Your Bond (as if you paid their cost).

fields.name: RISE LIKE THE SUN
fields.description: When you draw attention to yourself by word or deed, roll +CHA: on a 10+, everyone turns and looks, and you hold their gaze as long as you keep giving them reason to look; on a 7-9, everyone turns and looks.

fields.name: SPRING'S FIRST THAW
fields.description: When you spend time (an hour at least, maybe more) seeking to stir hope, kindness, or mercy in an NPC, roll +CHA: on a 10+, you light a fire deep within them and affect a lasting change; on a 7-9, you kindle goodness in their heart for now, but they will eventually return to their old ways; on a 6-, their heart hardens and, whatever else the GM says, you can’t use this move on them again.

fields.name: ARTS OF WAR
fields.description: Take a move from the Fox, Heavy, Judge, Ranger, or Seeker playbooks, for which you otherwise qualify. You can pick from a different playbook each time. You canΓÇÖt take Improved Stat or Superior Stat.

fields.name: VETERAN CREW
fields.description: Each time you take this move, pick 1. You can also choose to reselect their Instinct and Cost.
fields.description2:
• Select 2 new tags for your Crew
  • Increase their damage die from d6 to d8
  • Increase their max HP by 2 each

fields.name: FRONT LINE LEADER
fields.description: When you lead your crew into battle, hold 2 Presence. Spend Presence in lieu of your crewΓÇÖs Loyalty or as Readiness (as if you Defended them).

fields.name: READ THE LAND
fields.description: When you first take a moment to survey the terrain, ask the GM one of the following; gain advantage on your next roll to act on the answer.
fields.description2:
• WhatΓÇÖs the best way in, out, through, or past?
  • WhereΓÇÖs the best spot for a trap or an ambush?
  • WhereΓÇÖs the most defensible position?
  • What here is out of place?

fields.name: PREPARE A WELCOME
fields.description:
When you have your allies fortify a position and lie in wait for battle, hold 1 Surprise if youΓÇÖre rushed or 2 Surprises if you can take your time.

Once battle is joined, spend 1 Surprise to reveal a ploy, defense, or dirty trick you prepared in advance and roll +INT: on a 10+, it works as well as can be expected, and youΓÇÖve still got a few tricks up your sleeveΓÇöregain 1 Surprise; on a 7-9, it works as well as can be expected.

fields.name: SET-UP STRIKE
fields.description: When you Clash and get a 7+, you can choose to deal damage with disadvantage. If you do, you create an opening for ally to act on, as if you provided Aid. Describe it!

fields.name: SHAKE IT OFF
fields.description: When you order an ally to overcome fear, pain, doubt, or delusion, roll +CHA: on a 10+, they do it; on a 7-9, a PC gets advantage to do it; an NPC will do it, but theyΓÇÖll need time, theyΓÇÖll resent you, or theyΓÇÖll feel humiliated (GM decides).

fields.name: SHIELD WALL
fields.description: When you have your crew form a shield wall, they Defend with advantage and on a 7+ they hold +2 Readiness (instead of the usual +1 for shields). As long as they maintain formation, they can go on the offensive without losing Readiness.

fields.name: SIR, PERMISSION TO DIE, SIR
fields.description: When one of your followers would die, you can spend 1 of their Loyalty to have them survive (out of the action, but alive). If you let them go, mark XP.

fields.name: SPEAK SOFTLY
fields.description: When you offer peace but your enemy refuses, gain advantage on your next roll against them.

fields.name: STENTORIAN
fields.description:
When you raise your voice, it carries far and cuts through even the din of battle.

When you go into battle, hold 2 Command. You can spend 1 Command to shout an order or warning to an ally; they gain advantage on their next roll to do as you say.

fields.name: TAKE THE MEASURE
fields.description:
When you size someone up, ask their player one of the questions below and get an honest answer. If they fear or respect you (their call), you can ask another question. You canΓÇÖt use this move on them again until your relationship significantly changes.

  • Can I trust them (to ______ )?
  • What do they intend to do?
  • How are they most useful/dangerous?
  • What weakness of theirs can I exploit?

fields.name: WE HAPPY FEW
fields.description:
When you give an inspiring speech to your allies before facing a dire threat, roll +CHA: on a 10+, each ally holds 2 Inspiration; on a 7-9, each ally holds 1 Inspiration; on a 6-, each ally holds 1, but you have disadvantage on all rolls until you share your nagging doubts with someone else.

Once battle is joined, your allies can spend their Inspiration at any time, 1-for-1 to do the following:

  • Act fearlessly in the face of terror or overwhelming odds
  • Keep 1 HP instead of being reduced to 0 HP
  • Add 1d6 to a damage roll they just made

fields.name: BATTLEFIELD GRACE
fields.description: When you take damage while leading your allies in battle, the damage roll has disadvantage.

fields.name: HEROES TO THE LAST
fields.description: Each time you take this move, pick 1:
fields.description2:
• They are exceptional (and roll +2 instead of +1)
  • They are inured to terror & horror
  • Increase their max HP by 4 each
  • Increase their damage die one size (max d10)

fields.name: FOCUS FIRE
fields.description: You can spend 1 Command to order your allies to bring down a foe. If you do, each ally has advantage on their next damage roll against that foe.

fields.name: LIKE AN OPEN BOOK
fields.description: When you Take the Measure of someone who fears or respects you, your second question can be anything you want. The GM might ask how you could possibly know this; tell them or ask something else.

fields.name: NOBLE MIEN
fields.description: When you lead an NPC through danger and return them to safety, if they arenΓÇÖt part of your crew they will either offer to join your crew or pledge their future aid and support.

fields.name: PEACE THROUGH STRENGTH
fields.description: When you stand ready to fight alongside like-minded allies, anything capable of fear recognizes you as a serious threat and treats you accordingly.

fields.name: A SAFE PLACE
fields.description: When you select and prepare the partyΓÇÖs camp site, hold 1 Precaution, or 2 Precaution if you are well-versed with this area and its dangers. If trouble finds your camp site, you can spend 1 Precaution to reveal a simple defense, warning, or trick that you prepared in advance. If you do, tell us how you knew to make that specific preparation.

fields.name: MAGNIFICENT SPECIMEN
fields.description: Each time you take this move, your companion gains 2 additional options of your choice.

fields.name: BLOT OUT THE SUN
fields.description:
When you Let Fly with a bow, you can deplete your ammunition (mark the next ammo status after your weapon) before you roll. If you do, choose 1:

  • Gain advantage on your damage roll
  • Add the area tag to your attack; roll damage separately for each target

fields.name: CALL THE SHOT
fields.description:
When you take your time and calmly line up the perfect shot, either deal your damage or roll +DEX: on a 10+, deal your damage and pick 2; on a 7-9, deal your damage and pick 1.

  • Ignore armor or deal +1d4 damage (your call)
  • Stun, hobble, or hinder them
  • Make them trip or drop what theyΓÇÖre holding Do no harm; donΓÇÖt deal your damage after all

fields.name: MENTAL MAP
fields.description:
You can always retrace your steps and can accurately gauge distances and directions. You might not know the way forward but can always find your way back.

When you think back on a place youΓÇÖve been to or observed, you can retroactively Seek Insight about it as if you were still there.

fields.name: NATURALIST
fields.description: When you Know Things about beasts, natural environs, or spirits of the wild, you have advantage.

fields.name: ON THE HOOF
fields.description: When you travel through the wilderness, you can procure 1d6 uses of provisions each day (roll with disadvantage in winter or barren terrain). Each use of provisions can substitute for 1 supplies when you Make Camp.

fields.name: PACK HORSE
fields.description: You can carry up to 4 weight with a light load, 7 weight with a normal load, and 10 weight with a heavy load.

fields.name: PREDATOR
fields.description:
When you Seek Insight, add the following to the list of questions you can ask:

  • Who or what here is the easiest prey?
  • How is ________ weak or vulnerable?

When acting on the answer to either question, deal an extra 1d4 damage.

fields.name: SENSE THE UNNATURAL
fields.description: When you Seek Insight, you can always ask, ΓÇ£What here is a perversion of the natural order?ΓÇ¥ for free, even on a 6-.

fields.name: WILD SPEECH
fields.description: The grunts, barks, chirps, and calls of natural beasts are as a language to you. You can understand their intentions and communicate basic ideas. When you Persuade a beast, you can choose to roll +WIS.

fields.name: ALPHA
fields.description:
When you assert your dominance over a beast or spirit of the wild, roll +WIS: on a 7+, it must choose 1 from the list below; on a 10+, you also gain advantage on your next roll against it.

  • Fight you for dominance
  • Slink away or flee, then avoid you
  • Accept your authority, at least for now

fields.name: ATTUNED
fields.description: When you Seek Insight, you can always ask, ΓÇ£What here is infused with magic?ΓÇ¥ for free, even on a 6-.

fields.name: CONDUIT OF POWER
fields.description: When you would mark a Consequence from a major arcanum, you can mark 1 here instead, with no negative effect. (These marks never clear.)

fields.name: CONTERMEASURES
fields.description: When you witness a magical effect, you may ask the GM, ΓÇ£how can this be countered or interrupted?ΓÇ¥ and get an honest answer. You or an ally gain advantage on your next roll to act on the answer.

fields.name: EVERYTHING BURNS
fields.description: When you inspect a work of artifice or magic for a fatal flaw, roll +INT: on a 7+, the GM will reveal the best way to destroy/sabotage it; on a 10+, you or an ally also gain advantage to act on the info.

fields.name: LOGBOOK
fields.description: You have a logbook (2 uses, slow) that doesnΓÇÖt take up space in your inventory. When you (and only you) consult your logbook and expend a use, you can ignore a Know Things roll you just made and treat the result as a 10+. When the Seasons Change, reset your logbook to 2 uses.

fields.name: MAGPIE
fields.description:
When you Have What You Need, you can produce something strange, specific, maybe even valuable or a little bit magical, but if you do, tell us where you got it and 2 of the following:

  • How itΓÇÖs not quite right, but maybe itΓÇÖll do?
  • The trouble you caused back home by getting it
  • Why using it will draw unwanted attention
  • That itΓÇÖs the only thing like this that youΓÇÖve got, and why itΓÇÖll only work the one time

fields.name: NEVER AT A LOSS
fields.description: When you Know Things and roll a 6-, you may choose to not mark XP. If you donΓÇÖt mark XP, the worst that happens is that the GM tells you nothing interesting or useful about the subject, but instead tells you how you could learn more.

fields.name: CRYPTOLOGIST
fields.description: When you study encoded, forgotten, or arcane marks or writing, roll +INT: on a 10+, you can fully decipher them in just a few minutes; on a 7-9, you get the gist in a few minutes, but fully deciphering them will take you an hour or so.

fields.name: QUICK STUDY
fields.description: When you study something magical that should take months to understand, it instead takes mere weeks. If it should take weeks, it takes days. If it should take days, it takes only a few hours

fields.name: SAFETY FIRST
fields.description: When you spend an hour or so preparing your mystical defenses, hold 2 Protection. When you are affected by harmful magic, spend 1 Protection to halve the damage or effect.

fields.name: SAGE ADVICE
fields.description: When someone asks you for guidance, they get advantage on their next roll to follow your advice.

fields.name: ARCANE ADEPT
fields.description: When you wish to invent a spell or magical effect, detail its workings with the GM (using existing arcana for guidance). Then, Make a Plan to invent it. If you like, pick one of the GMΓÇÖs statements and ask them to provide an alternative (for example ΓÇ£first you must _____ΓÇ¥ could become ΓÇ£first you must _____, or it will take monthsΓÇ¥).

fields.name: DEEP INSIGHT
fields.description: When you Seek Insight about a magical object, effect, or creature, you may ask one additional question, not limited to the list. Even on a 6-, you get to ask this question.

fields.name: IMPROVISE
fields.description: When you attempt to use or trigger one of an arcanumΓÇÖs mysteries without having unlocked it, roll +INT: on a 7+, you pull it off, at least this once; on a 10+, you also unlock that mystery in the process.

fields.name: MIND OVER MAGIC
fields.description: When you roll to study or use an arcanum, you can roll +INT instead of whatever stat you would normally roll.

fields.name: OVERCHANNEL
fields.description: When you would mark a Consequence from a major arcanum, you may mark a debility instead.

fields.name: PROOF AGAINST DETECTION
fields.description: When you hold Protection, you canΓÇÖt be scried upon or sensed by magical means, and have advantage to Defy Danger by being stealthy

fields.name: SPEAK TRUTH TO POWER
fields.description: When you demand that someone does what is clearly good and right, you have advantage to Persuade. If they refuse, gain +1 Resolve.

fields.name: BETTER PART OF VALOR
fields.description: When you are outnumbered or facing a foe bigger than you, you have advantage to hide from, escape from, or sneak past them.

fields.name: I GET KNOCKED DOWN
fields.description:
When you take damage despite your best efforts to avoid it, you can choose to halve the damage but pick 1 of the following:

  • You lose something (footing, grip, etc.)
  • Something on your person breaks
  • YouΓÇÖre out of it for a moment

Whatever you choose, the GM will describe the details.

fields.name: BUT I GET UP AGAIN
fields.description: When you use I Get Knocked Down, you have advantage on your next roll against whatever dealt the damage and your next blow against them does +1d4 damage.

fields.name: IN OVER YOUR HEAD
fields.description: When another PC rescues you from danger, mark XP.

fields.name: IRON WILL
fields.description: When you are subject to mind control or magic that affects your feelings, you can take 1d4 damage (ignoring armor) to disregard its influence.

fields.name: INQUIRING MINDS
fields.description: When you seek out and receive honest advice, gain advantage on your next roll to follow that advice.

fields.name: NEVER GONNA KEEP ME DOWN
fields.description: When you have 5 or fewer current HP, you impose disadvantage on any damage you take. Once per session, when you are at DeathΓÇÖs Door, donΓÇÖt roll. You get a 10+.

fields.name: RESOURCEFUL
fields.description: When you Defy Danger and roll a 6-, ask the GM a question from Seek Insight after they describe what happens. Gain advantage on your next roll to act on the answer.

fields.name: SOMETHING TO REMEMBER ME BY
fields.description: When you spend Readiness (from Defend) to strike back at an attacker, you deal +1d4 damage and scar, mark, or diminish them in some way (the GM will say how, or ask you to).

fields.name: TOUGH LOVE
fields.description: When you honestly think another PC is in the wrong and call them on it, they have disadvantage on any rolls against you until you two work it out.

fields.name: UNDERESTIMATED
fields.description:
As long as you avoid overt hostility, no enemy will consider you a threat.

When you first make your move against an enemy who underestimates you, you have advantage.

fields.name: UP WITH PEOPLE
fields.description:
When you converse with someone (PC or NPC) you can hold 2 Rapport with them. If you do, they hold 1 Rapport with you. During the conversation, either of you can spend 1 Rapport to ask the other player one of the following and get an honest answer.

  • What weighs you down or holds you back?
  • What drives you forward?
  • What lesson would you have me learn?
  • What do you think of me, truly?
Increase the stat you rolled by 1, to a max of +2

Increase your max HP by 4
Increase your damage die to a d8

It cannot be cut, torn, or burned by any natural means.
Unless someone is specifically searching for your pouch, they will ignore its presence.
So long as the pouch is sealed, nothing within can be detected or found by magic, nor can anything within escape or affect the outside world.
Unnatural and unclean creatures cannot bear to touch it.

fields.history_description: drove off a thunder drake that got too close to town.
killed that hagr in the Foothills
slew a dozen crinwin in one battle.
tossed those adventurers out of town.
bested Ivan, the scariest bandit in Brennan's gang, the Claws.
dragged yourself (and another?) into town bleeding from a dozen wounds.
were struck by lightning and woke up covered in these marks.
the look in your eye when you spilled all that blood.
those hard cases who showed up looking for you.
the shouting matches between you and your love.
the time you spent as one of Brennan's Claws.
What happened to Urbgen, even if he did have it coming
That thrice-damned temper of yours.
The worry that someone's coming after you.
The feeling that the crinwin are getting bolder.

your uncontrollable seizures, where you claw
 those weird marks in the dirt.

Wondering what BrennanΓÇÖs up to, now that heΓÇÖs
 the marshal of Marshedge.

Dark visions of things moving in the earth,
 restless, whispering and hungry.

The question of whoΓÇÖll look after your family
 when you get yourself killed.

The worry that theyΓÇÖll all learn the truth about
 you, sooner or later.

fields.chronical_description: it is a sturdy vault from the time of the Makers.
has plenty of room to grow.
sits on the outskirts, near the Old Wall.
has but one entrance, magically sealed.
bears minor magicks to preserve its contents.
is warded against spirits and magic.
is little more than a crude cellar.

fields.description: truth, honesty, and forthrightness
hospitality, freely given to all who ask for it.
the punishment of thieves & oathbreakers
adherence to strict rules of diet and dress
respect for authority, property, and rank
utterly immune to all magic (close, forceful, awkward, +1 damage)
etched with Aratis's symbol (indestructible, +1 armor, +1 Readiness on a Defend 7+)
set with a dark ice “jewel.” Protects your mind from magical influence.

fields.name: lived long ago, a figure of legend
died facing a mighty sorcerer or demon
wrote many works of sublime beauty
faced one of the Things Below
BATH OF HEALING LIGHT
fields.description:
Cup your hands around your light and focus it.

Your patient... (pick 2):

  • Regains 5 HP (can pick this twice)
  • Clears a debility (can pick this twice)
  • Has one of their problematic wounds stabilized
  • Recovers from a minor condition (drunk, etc.)

Reduced: pick only 1 (instead of 2).

Empowered: add these to your possible choices:

  • Regains 10 HP (can pick this twice)
  • Fully recovers from a problematic wound
  • Is cured of a dire affliction, poison, or disease

fields.name: BLINDING LIGHT
fields.description:
Your light blazes. Any in range who look at it are temporarily blinded. Those not looking at it directly must avert their eyes. You are unaffected.

Reduced: the light flares only for a moment.

Empowered: if you wish, your allies are unaffected.

fields.name: CLEANSING LIGHT
fields.description:
Your light flares, dispelling magic within range. Potent, lasting magics are merely suppressed, and slowly return to power once removed from your light.

Reduced: potent, lasting magics are unaffected; other magic is merely suppressed.

Empowered: the invocation is ongoing; while it lasts, any magic brought into range is dispelled/ suppressed.

fields.name: COLD LIGHT OF DAY
fields.description:
All in your light appears as it really is, without the benefit of illusion, shapeshifting, or disguise.

Reduced: it lasts only a few moments, just long enough to glimpse the truth.

Empowered: illusions in the light are dispelled and shapeshifters in the light are momentarily stunned.

fields.name: DANCING LIGHT
fields.description:
Your light takes to the air, floating as you direct it, untethered from its fuel. You can move it anywhere that you can see it, and even change its shape or color.

Reduced: it dims, reducing its range by one step.

Empowered: you can use another Invocation through the Dancing Light while it is ongoing.

fields.name: GO BACK TO THE SHADOW
fields.description:
Spirits of darkness in your light take 2d8 damage (ignores armor). Roll damage for each spirit separately. A spirit reduced to 0 HP is either banished from this world or back to whatever tethers it here.

Reduced: affected spirits take only 1d8 damage.

Empowered: a spirit reduced to 0 HP is either utterly destroyed OR it’s banished from the world and anything tethering it here is destroyed (GM’s choice).

fields.name: HOLD BACK THE DARKNESS
fields.description:
Spirits and creatures of darkness are repelled by your light and cannot approach. The cowardly or mindless flee outright. Those forced into range of your light deal damage with disadvantage.

Reduced: you must maintain an unbroken litany of prayers in order to maintain the effect.

Empowered: affected entities that are forced into range of your light are vulnerable to mundane weapons, their supernatural defenses suppressed.

fields.name: MOTH TO A FLAME
fields.description:
Name an individual or type of mortal creature. They gaze raptly at your light and will follow it, slowly. The effect ends if they take damage.

Reduced: it lasts only briefly OR only some of the named creatures are affected (GM’s choice).

Empowered: the effect continues for a few moments after they first take damage. Taking damage a second time ends the effect immediately.

fields.name: TERRIBLE AS THE DAWN
fields.description:
Name an individual or type of mortal creature. Your light fills them with dread, causing them to recoil and back away. The cowardly flee outright.

Reduced: all mortal creatures but you are affected, including your allies.

Empowered: even the brave must cower or flee.

fields.name: WARMTH OF THE SUN
fields.description:
While in your light, you and your allies are free of fear and doubt, and unharmed by extreme cold.

Reduced: only one person in the light is protected.

Empowered: the light also protects from necromantic and life-draining effects.

fields.name: MINDWALKING
fields.description:
When you use the Ice-Sphere as a psychic anchor, your consciousness leaves your body and walks the world as a spirit, invisible and insubstantial. Roll +INT: on a 10+, hold 3 Power; on a 7-9, hold 2 Power; on a 6-, hold 2 Power and mark a Consequence. While mindwalking, you may spend your Power, 1-for-1 to:

  • Manifest as a ghostly voice and/or presence
  • Manipulate a small (weight 0), unattended object
  • Return instantly to the Ice-Sphere from any distance

For every 2 Consequences you mark, you will gain one of the complementary moves below:

fields.name: A MIGHTY WILL
fields.description: When you mindwalk, hold +1 Power.

fields.name: STORM'S FURY
fields.description:
When you begin to roil with anger, your markings crackle with electricity and the air thrums with pressure. Roll +CON: on a 10+, hold 3 Fury; on a 7-9, hold 2 Fury; on a 6-, hold 2 Fury but also mark a consequence. You may spend Fury 1-for-1 to manifest one of the following:

  • Imbue your next strike with the force of thunder (+1d6 damage, forceful, loud)
  • Move like lightning, closing the distance between you and a foe before they can react
  • Bellow like a the storm itself, drawing no small amount of attention and making craven foes cringe in fear

When you mark a third consequence, you can use Chosen of the Storm-Bringer.

fields.name: CHOSEN OF THE STORM-BRINGER
fields.description:
Add these to the list of potential manifestations granted by Storm’s Fury:

  • Roll +CON to Let Fly with a bolt of lightning (2d6 damage, thrown, forceful, loud, dangerous, ignores armor)
  • Make a prodigious leap, buoyed by the wind
  • Summon a powerful gale with you at its center—dirt and debris swirl about, the wind is deafening, people must brace themselves to keep from getting bowled over, projectiles careen off course—and take disadvantage on all rolls as long as you sustain it
Your physical body withers and fadesΓÇöpermanently mark the Weakened debility

Your emotions dull. You can no longer be affected by fear, hate, or other
 powerful emotions (for good or ill).

Replace your instinct with ΓÇ£Detachment: To distance yourself from human
 connections and emotions.ΓÇ¥

Your skin tinges bluish; your body becomes cold to the touch. You are unaffected
 by even the bitterest cold, but find heat and warmth unbearable.
When you take damage from fire, roll twice and take the higher result.

You draw the attention of some powerful, hungry entity of the spirit
 world. It has your scent. Should you destroy or bind it, erase this mark.

When you roll 6- at DeathΓÇÖs Door, you have no choice: gain the Ghost insert
 (with the Ice-Sphere as your tether).

Lightning begins to arc off of you, striking objects and creatures nearby at
 random for 2d6 damage (near, forceful, loud, ignores armor). This lasts until you

A gale of winds forms around you, as with Chosen of the Storm-Bringer
 (even if you canΓÇÖt normally use that move). You canΓÇÖt dismiss it easily; the effects

Name an NPC who is present and whose regard you value. They are terrified of
 the power you wield and grow distant.

From now on, when you gain Fury, gain +1 Fury. But you also have disadvantage
 on rolls to control your temper.

A storm forms (or worsens) in your immediate area. It arrives unnaturally fast,
 but not miraculously so.

A terrible storm begins to form in your immediate area and pummels the entire
 region. Blizzards, tornados, floodsΓÇöitΓÇÖs bad.

A storm begins to form (as above), and the weather patterns are freakish and
unpredictable for the next few months. Each steading in the region takes -2 to
their next roll for Surplus and their next Seasons Change roll is automatically
a 6-.
Recover its chassis of white granite, which weighs well over a ton
Recover its Γùç “heart,” a chunk of makerglass that forever burns with terrible heat (indestructable, dangerous)
Recover and repair the intricate ΓùçΓùç bronze helm (awkward, big) that serves as a casing for the Mindgem
Puzzle out how to assemble all the pieces
consult with a disciple of the Rime Lords (or one of their troves of lore) to learn the recipe and mantra that makes the lamp work.
acquire the special ingredients for the clarified mammoth-butter to be burned in the lamp (Value 1).
